pe_description: The Logistics & Deliveries sub-sector in Indonesia exhibits a P/E ratio of 6.46, outperforming its historical performance and ranking fifth among other sub-sectors. Notably, four companies within this sub-sector, namely '###Samudera Indonesia Tbk####', '###PT Hasnur Internasional Shipping Tbk####', and '###Berlian Laju Tanker Tbk####', are considered undervalued based on their P/E ratios, while '###PT Putra Rajawali Kencana Tbk.####' is deemed overvalued and should be approached with caution. Factors influencing the growth of this sub-sector include e-commerce penetration, infrastructure development, and government regulations specific to logistics and deliveries.
health_description: The Logistics & Deliveries sub-sector in Indonesia, comprising 25 companies, has shown a weaker performance compared to the overall IDX in the last 30 days. Only 4 out of 25 companies exhibited positive price changes during this period. Factors that can influence the sub-sector's health index include the number of new listings, barriers to entry, and government regulations. The Indonesian government body responsible for regulating the Logistics & Deliveries sub-sector is the Ministry of Transportation, whose policies and decisions can impact the resilience of the sub-sector.
growth_description: The Logistics & Deliveries sub-sector in Indonesia experienced a decline in average YoY quarter earnings changes of -17.03% and a moderate growth in average YoY quarter revenue changes of 6.73% over the past year. The sub-sector ranked 25th in terms of earnings and 22nd in terms of revenue compared to other sub-sectors. ###Mitra Investindo Tbk#### emerged as the company with the highest YoY earning growth, ###Mitra Investindo Tbk#### also had the highest YoY revenue growth, and ###Pelayaran Nelly Dwi Putri Tbk#### recorded the highest net profit margin within the sub-sector. The growth of the Logistics & Deliveries sub-sector can be influenced by various factors, including changes in consumer behavior, technological advancements in logistics and delivery services, shifts in regulatory policies specific to the sub-sector, and overall economic conditions.
